clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Performance in Paralympic Athletes: Performance Outcomes in Sports

detailed_description.textblock: The sportive performance results from a range of determinations such as: physiological, biomechanical, morphological, psychological, social and environmental factors. The interactions between athletes, equipment, training and environment influences the development of athletes' performance. In the context of the coming Paris 2024 Paralympic Games, the performance construction for the exploration, the quantification and the management of all factors is an commun objective between sportive team, medical team and researchers.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomechanical indices of performance: isometric power measurement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Isometric power will be measured by MicroFet & handgrip of 26 measures, advice for healthcare professionals to measure handgrip strength forces to test and document grip deficits and to evaluate consistency of effort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomechanical indices of performance: arms and shoulder's Strength
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Arms and shoulder's Strength will be measured by force platform.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physiological indices of performance: maximal aerobic speed (MAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice through study completion, an average of 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal aerobic speed (MAS) will be measured by Repetition Per Minute on a Arm ergometer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physiological indices of performance: maximal aerobic power
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice through study completion, an average of 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal aerobic power will be measured by following Watts fluctuation during the incremental hand-biking test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Twice through study completion, an average of 42 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fatigue assessment will be measured by Fatigue Index (Power max ratio).
